oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Conic-Helical Orbits of Planets around Binary Stars do not Exist
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Egan, Greg
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Dynamical Systems
Astrophysics - Earth and Planetary Astrophysics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oks proposes the existence of stable planetary orbits around binary stars, in the shape of a helix on a conical surface whose axis of symmetry coincides with the interstellar axis. We show that planetary orbits initially meeting this description will not continue to do so as the binary pair rotates.
Comment: 3 pages. Submitted to The Astrophysical Journal
